Is there a reason to change the font away form Ostrich?
Also now that you didn't update the global.css that uses Ostrich the feature can't be validated visually by opening the application.

I think I've just mixed up the semantics of global.css and document.css.
According to a feature design doc:

A special document.css stylesheet for css that doesn’t work inside SD and need to be loaded into the document root, such as @font-face declarations, when these need to work for components embedded into a non-Vaadin-app such as the design system documentation tool (DocBuilder).
Java components exported as WCs using Flow’s WebComponentExporter apply the theme’s styles automatically inside the exported WC and css defined in document.css (e.g. @font-face declarations) to the document itself.

The Ostrich font defined/imported in document.css and assigned in global.css within the :host block, should be propagated to document root and applied to an embedded component.
So, I've reverted the changes to global css and font folder and changed the tests accordingly.
Same script as above, but the result should be false as the @font-face declaration should not be added to the embedded component.
